key_points: Kamala Harris has sold her Washington, D.C. condo for $1.85 million.
The condo was initially put on the market for $1,995,000.
Located in the Westlight luxury condominium complex, the home features two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and natural oak hardwood floors.
Harris purchased the condo for $1,775,400 in 2017.
Real estate agent Courtney Abrams described the condo's location as prime and well priced.
Following her inauguration, Harris temporarily resided at Blair House due to renovations at the traditional vice president's residence.
Vice President Harris and Doug Emhoff moved into the Naval Observatory residence in April.
Renovations at the Observatory residence included HVAC, chimney, and hardwood floor maintenance.
Harris also sold a one-bedroom condo in San Francisco for $860,000 in March.
Harris and Emhoff still own a home in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles.
spokespersons: Courtney Abrams (Washington, D.C.-based real estate agent, TTR Sotheby's International Realty)
Symone Sanders (Chief spokeswoman for Vice President Kamala Harris)
